Class OptionLabel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.Component

          • com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.OptionLabel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Component>

    public class OptionLabel
extends Label
    A UI component that circles through a collection of values when clicked.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OptionLabel

        public OptionLabel(int x,
                   int y,
                   int height,
                   int width,
                   boolean visible,
                   java.lang.String selected,
                   java.lang.String[] options,
                   Component parent)
        Create a new Option Label
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the top left corner of the component relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of the component.relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        height - The height of the component.
        width - The width of the component.
        visible - The visibility state of the new component.
        selected - The option that should be selected when the component is first shown to the user.
        options - All the options that will be displayed on the component.
        parent - The component that contains this component or null if this component has no parent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the options array is empty.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the selected option is not contained within the options array.
        Effect:
        The OptionLabel is initialized as a label with the given parameters.
            super(x, y, height, width, visible, selected, parent)

      • OptionLabel

        public OptionLabel(int x,
                   int y,
                   int height,
                   int width,
                   java.lang.String selected,
                   java.lang.String[] options,
                   Component parent)
        Create a new visible Option Label
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the top left corner of the component relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of the component.relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        height - The height of the component.
        width - The width of the component.
        selected - The option that should be selected when the component is first shown to the user.
        options - All the options that will be displayed on the component.
        parent - The component that contains this component or null if this component has no parent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the options array is empty.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the selected option is not contained within the options array.
        Effect:
        The OptionLabel is initialized with the given parameters and true for the visible parameter.
            this(x, y, height, width, true, selected, parent)

      • OptionLabel

        public OptionLabel(java.lang.String selected,
                   java.lang.String[] options,
                   Component parent)
        Create a new visible Option Label with a 0 surface area.
        Parameters:
        selected - The option that should be selected when the component is first shown to the user.
        options - All the options that will be displayed on the component.
        parent - The component that contains this component or null if this component has no parent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the options array is empty.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the selected option is not contained within the options array.
        Effect:
        The OptionLabel is initialized with 0 for the area parameters.
            this(0, 0, 0, 0, true, selected, parent)

        Parameters:

        x - The x coordinate of the mouse click.
        y - The y coordinate of the mouse click.
        clickCount - The number of times that was clicked.
